message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.RO, cs.MM

The paper deals with the problem of 3D human pose and shape estimation from 2D images using deep learning and a statistical body model. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel approach that integrates a CNN with a statistical body model, which involves training the model using both 2D and 3D annotations. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of semantic body part segmentation and top-down body model constraints, which may fall under the graphics (cs.GR) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories, respectively. Finally, the paper presents detailed experiments and analysis of the proposed approach, which may also fall under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
